div.p: All Learners Achieving Individual Potential

hr.p: In our ongoing effort to provide updated information to our Forest Hills community, we have created this page to address questions we are receiving, and for the sharing of information, guidance, and resources as it becomes available. Please remember that information is changing rapidly. If you have immediate health concerns, you are asked to call your primary care physician or the Kent County Health Department, 616-632-7100. Everyone can do their part to help and be supportive during this uncertain time. Children take their cues from adults. By upholding the district’s guiding principles of caring, collaboration, open communication, respect, and trust, we are confident that we will get through this together, as a community. We appreciate your cooperation and trust as we proactively work together for everyone’s safety.
hr.h2: Commonly-Asked Questions the District is Receiving about COVID-19

div.div: Does FHPS have resources to support remote learning?

div.p: Yes. Links to resources curated to offer high-interest low-stress ideas that families may choose to use with their children, in addition to the learning opportunities they are receiving from their teachers, are available online. The goal is to offer new optional ideas and resources for students and families weekly.

div.div: How will FHPS support student learning at home while school is canceled?

p.span: about the loss of face-to-face learning for our own students and those across our state and country. Forest Hills Public Schools believes in providing instruction that is grounded in evidence. We know that learning through direct instruction, social interactions, inquiry, and authentic problem-solving provide the best learning outcomes for learners of all ages.

With schools closed through April 12, our first instructional priority is to ensure that students and families are connected with their teachers whether by email, phone, Google for Education apps (or other platforms and tools teachers may already be using). By now, students and families should have received communications from teachers and principals regarding the communication strategies that will be used in each school. If you have not received communication, please reach out to your principal as it is possible that we have incorrect contact information for you.

While it can be difficult to introduce new concepts and learning topics in the absence of direct and in-person instruction, teachers will strive to provide important and engaging learning recommendations for students to deepen learning by reviewing, reinforcing, and practicing previously taught essential learning standards. The goal of these activities will be to support and deepen learning and to offer students opportunities to pursue personal learning interests. Students and families are encouraged, but not required, to follow the recommended learning activities that their teachers are sharing with them. To support those wishing additional enrichment opportunities for exploration at home, FHPS will be curating learning resources to share on a weekly basis. Stay tuned for more information.

Depending on the age and learning preferences of students, online platforms can be useful for practicing, exploring, and learning; but they can never replace the expert, in-person instruction FHPS teachers provide on a daily basis. Many online providers are offering standards-aligned resources, free of charge, for use during school closures to supplement learning for families who wish to access them.
is a provider that offers extensive resources for students in grades 6-12, as well as a growing number of resources for grades K-5. Click
for suggested daily schedules for learners of all ages.

We share the worries and challenges all families are facing while we grapple with the unexpected loss of face-to-face learning time with our students. Please be assured that your children’s teachers, principals, and the entire FHPS staff are working hard to continue to support them. As your partners in education, we are frustrated that we are not able to serve our students with face-to-face learning in our classrooms. Our staff will continue to share at-home learning opportunities for students and families while we follow guidelines and recommendations from the Michigan Department of Education and the U.S. Department of Education to keep school closed.
Your support and understanding are appreciated. We are so grateful for a school community that is committed to supporting our students during this unprecedented and challenging time.

div.div: Are schools closed?

div.p: Yes. The school buildings are closed, but learning continues.

div.div: When will I, or my student, be permitted to access the school building again to retrieve additional belongings?

div.p: In March, each school principal communicated with families their dates and times the school was open to get personal belongings. Now that those dates have passed buildings remain closed. Principals will communicate at a later date the schedule to retrieve additional belongings.

div.div: Is the administration building closed, too?

div.p: Yes, the administration building is closed to the public. If you have questions, you are encouraged to use email. A staff directory is available online.

div.div: What if I'd like to help or volunteer? Does FHPS need anything or can I do anything?

div.p: Thank you for offering. At the present time, FHPS is all set with matters as it relates to food distribution, online learning, and more. We are so thankful and grateful to our community and we will not hesitate to ask if there’s anything we need our community to do. Stay well and be healthy.

div.div: Are you canceling events, and if so, which ones?

div.p: All school-related activities, practices, and events have been canceled until further notice. This also includes events and activities at the Forest Hills Fine Arts Center and Community Services and Aquatics Center. School athletic decisions are being made by the Michigan High School Athletic Association. Here is their announcement dated April 8, 2020.

div.div: What about prom and commencement? Are they being canceled?

div.p: Decisions have not been made at this time, as situations are rapidly changing and evolving. We will have to wait and see.

div.div: Will schools be required to make up this time and therefore will our school year be extended?

div.p: At the present time, we have not received information from the state regarding whether or not there will be any flexibility to the requirements pertaining to days and hours of instruction. This will be an issue all public schools will be watching closely.

div.div: What if I need to get in contact with an FHPS employee, teacher, or principal during the closure?

div.p: Our employees throughout the district are monitoring emails to serve our families. We have an online staff directory and department listings and we encourage you to use email. Please be patient as it may take us longer to respond to inquiries.

div.div: What should I do if my child is sick, or I am sick?

div.p: Stay at home and contact your personal health care provider for health concerns or primary care physician. While Spectrum Health is offering free virtual screenings, if you are sick, do not automatically assume you have COVID-19. Screening is specifically for individuals in the state of Michigan who have COVID-19 symptoms and may be concerned they have the virus. With this initial screening, Spectrum can help prevent the spread of infection, while offering an easy and convenient option for community members to be assessed. Callers to a hotline number (616-391-2380) will be scheduled for a free virtual screening visit through Spectrum Health Now.

div.div: Does the district have enough supplies, like hand sanitizer, soap? What cleaning measures are being taken while the schools are closed?

div.p: Currently, the district has soap and hand sanitizer available when students and staff do return to school. We do have Electrostatic Sprayers that can clean a classroom in a matter of minutes. Our custodial staff is cleaning and disinfecting all the buildings so we are ready for the return for students and staff.

div.div: How are you cleaning buses?

div.p: Our transportation department is doing its part by disinfecting buses so we are ready for the return of students.

div.div: Are there devices from the school and district that are being deployed to support remote learning?

div.p: Yes. To help support our students and families, the district has distribution times for technology devices. Please see the news post regarding this. As for instruction, students and families should be receiving emails from their teacher(s) as to ways they are supporting their students’ continued learning, enrichment, discovery, and/or exploration.

div.div: What about enrolling in kindergarten for next year?

div.p: All of the paperwork and forms needed for enrollment in kindergarten are located online. At the very least, complete the online pre-enrollment form. As for returning the forms and presenting the additional required documents, please wait until schools are open or until the district announces other arrangements.

div.div: What if I have questions regarding the Schools of Choice program?

div.p: Many answers can be found online on our website under Schools of Choice. Specific questions should be emailed to soc@fhps.net.

div.div: What if I still have questions?

div.p: If you have additional questions for Forest Hills Public Schools, please email your questions to us. We will update this page with additional answers to questions we receive from our community.
